translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Reversal of the Law

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  paritta ttika ādi

original: Naparittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca paritto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na parittam dhammam paṭicca parittaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With respect to the condition being limited, a limited phenomenon arises by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dvāvīsa, ārammaṇe ekādasa, adhipatiyā aṭṭhārasa …pe… aññamaññe soḷasa …pe… purejāte āsevane nava …pe… avigate dvāvīsa.
analyzed: hetuyā dvāvīsa ārammaṇe ekādasa adhipatiyā aṭṭhārasa pe aññamaññe soḷasa pe purejāte āsevane nava pe avigate dvāvīsa
translated: With respect to the condition being a root, there are twenty-two. With respect to the condition being an object, there are eleven. With respect to the condition being predominance, there are eighteen. … With respect to the condition being mutuality, there are sixteen. … With respect to the condition being prior, there are nine. … With respect to the condition being non-disappearance, there are twenty-two.

original: Naparittārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parittārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na paritta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca paritta ārammaṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to the condition being an object of a limited phenomenon, a limited phenomenon arises by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe terasa, adhipatiyā nava …pe… purejāte āsevane nava …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe terasa adhipatiyā nava pe purejāte āsevane nava pe avigate terasa
translated: With respect to the condition being a root, there are thirteen. With respect to the condition being an object, there are thirteen. With respect to the condition being predominance, there are nine. … With respect to the condition being prior, there are nine. … With respect to the condition being non-disappearance, there are thirteen.

original: Nahīnaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca majjhimo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hīnam dhammam paṭicca majjhimaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With respect to the condition being a low phenomenon, a middling phenomenon arises by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: With respect to the condition being a root, there are eighteen. With respect to the condition being an object, there are nine. … With respect to the condition being result, there are three. … With respect to the condition being non-disappearance, there are eighteen.

original: Namicchattaniyataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sammattaniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: na micchatta niyatam dhammam paṭicca sammatta niyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: With wrongness as condition, rightness … (Abbreviated.)🔽With cause as condition, the eighteen … (Abbreviated.)🔽With the path as object, a factor of the path … (Abbreviated.)

original: Namaggārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā chabbīsa …pe… avigate chabbīsa.
analyzed: na magga ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca magga hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā 🔽hetuyā chabbīsa pe avigate chabbīsa
translated: With cause as condition, twenty-six … (Abbreviated.) With nonequipoise as condition, twenty-six … (Abbreviated.)
